intro: Parodia copavilquensis, commonly known as the Copavilquén cactus, is a species native to the arid regions of northern Chile. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems and dense clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and low precipitation. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
